name: Scrolling Stat
example:
<scrolling-stat
  data-duration="800"
  data-number-end="100"
  data-number-start="0"
  data-text="sprockets and stuff"
  data-unit="%" />
description: Web component that displays a number that counts up or down to another number when the element is scrolled into view.

attributes.name: data-duration
attributes.description: The duration of the animation in milliseconds.
attributes.notes: The default value is 800 milliseconds if the attribute is not specified.

attributes.name: data-number-start
attributes.description: The number to start counting from.
attributes.notes: The default will be 0 if the attribute is not specified and if they number_end is greater than 49 or less than -49.  If the number_end is between -49 and 49, the default will be either -99 or 99 respectively.

attributes.name: data-number-end
attributes.notes: The default will be 99 if the attribute is not specified.

attributes.name: data-text
attributes.description: The caption to display after the number. For example, the number might be 100% and the text might be 'year over year increase in revenue'.
attributes.notes: The default will be an empty string if the attribute is not specified.

attributes.name: data-unit
attributes.description: The unit to display after the number. For example, if the number is 100 and the unit is '%', the number will be displayed as '100%'.
attributes.notes: The default will be an empty string if the attribute is not specified.
